019package org.jgrapes.webconsole.rbac;
020
021import java.util.Collections;
022import java.util.HashMap;
023import java.util.HashSet;
024import java.util.List;
025import java.util.Map;
026import java.util.Set;
027import java.util.stream.Collectors;
028import org.jgrapes.core.Channel;
029import org.jgrapes.core.Component;
030import org.jgrapes.core.Event;
031import org.jgrapes.core.Manager;
032import org.jgrapes.core.annotation.Handler;
033import org.jgrapes.util.events.ConfigurationUpdate;
034import org.jgrapes.webconsole.base.ConsoleConnection;
035import org.jgrapes.webconsole.base.ConsoleRole;
036import org.jgrapes.webconsole.base.WebConsoleUtils;
037import org.jgrapes.webconsole.base.events.AddConletRequest;
038import org.jgrapes.webconsole.base.events.AddConletType;
039import org.jgrapes.webconsole.base.events.ConsolePrepared;
040import org.jgrapes.webconsole.base.events.RenderConletRequest;
041import org.jgrapes.webconsole.base.events.UpdateConletType;
042
043/**
044 * Configures the conlets available based on the user currently logged in.
045 */
046@SuppressWarnings("PMD.DataflowAnomalyAnalysis")
047public class RoleConletFilter extends Component {
048
049    /**
050     * The possible permissions.
051     */
052    private enum Permission {
053        ADD, RENDER
054    }
055
056    @SuppressWarnings("PMD.UseConcurrentHashMap")
057    private final Map<String, List<String>> acl = new HashMap<>();
058    private final Set<String> knownTypes = new HashSet<>();
059
060    /**
061     * Creates a new component with its channel set to the given 
062     * channel.
063     *
064     * @param componentChannel the channel that the component's
065     * handlers listen on by default and that 
066     * {@link Manager#fire(Event, Channel...)} sends the event to
067     */
068    public RoleConletFilter(Channel componentChannel) {
069        super(componentChannel);
070    }
071
072    /**
073     * Creates a new component with its channel set to the given 
074     * channel.
075     *
076     * Supported properties are:
077     * 
078     *  * *conletTypesByRole*: see {@link #setConletTypesByRole(Map)}.
079     *
080     * @param componentChannel the channel that the component's
081     * handlers listen on by default and that 
082     * {@link Manager#fire(Event, Channel...)} sends the event to
083     * @param properties the properties used to configure the component
084     */
085    @SuppressWarnings({ "PMD.ConstructorCallsOverridableMethod", "unchecked",
086        "PMD.AvoidDuplicateLiterals" })
087    public RoleConletFilter(Channel componentChannel,
088            Map<?, ?> properties) {
089        super(componentChannel);
090        setConletTypesByRole((Map<String, List<String>>) properties
091            .get("conletTypesByRole"));
092    }
093
094    /**
095     * Sets the permitted conlet types by role. The parameter
096     * is a Map<String, List<String>> holding the conlet permissions
097     * to be added for the given role. The permissions can be an 
098     * asterisk ("*") to allow usage of all conlet types. It can be
099     * a conlet type as reported by {@link AddConletType#conletType()}
100     * to allow the usage of a particular conlet. The type may be 
101     * prefixed with an exclamation mark to deny the usage (default).
102     *
103     * The first match is used, i.e. the asterisk makes only sense
104     * as the last element in the list.
105     *
106     * @param acl the acl
107     * @return the user role conlet filter
108     */
109    @SuppressWarnings({ "PMD.LinguisticNaming",
110        "PMD.AvoidInstantiatingObjectsInLoops" })
111    public RoleConletFilter
112            setConletTypesByRole(Map<String, List<String>> acl) {
113        // Deep copy (and cleanup)
114        this.acl.clear();
115        this.acl.putAll(acl);
116        for (var e : this.acl.entrySet()) {
117            e.setValue(e.getValue().stream().map(String::trim)
118                .collect(Collectors.toList()));
119        }
120        return this;
121    }
122
123    /**
124     * The component can be configured with events that include
125     * a path (see @link {@link ConfigurationUpdate#paths()})
126     * that matches this components path (see {@link Manager#componentPath()}).
127     * 
128     * The following properties are recognized:
129     * 
130     * `conletTypesByRole`
131     * : Invokes {@link #setConletTypesByRole(Map)} with the
132     *   given values.
133     * 
134     * @param event the event
135     */
136    @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
137    @Handler
138    public void onConfigUpdate(ConfigurationUpdate event) {
139        event.structured(componentPath())
140            .map(c -> (Map<String, List<String>>) c
141                .get("conletTypesByRole"))
142            .ifPresent(this::setConletTypesByRole);
143    }
144
145    /**
146     * Collect known types for wildcard handling
147     *
148     * @param event the event
149     */
150    @Handler
151    public void onAddConletType(AddConletType event) {
152        knownTypes.add(event.conletType());
153    }
154
155    /**
156     * Disable all conlets that the user is not allowed to use
157     * by firing {@link UpdateConletType} events with no render modes.
158     * The current user is obtained from 
159     * {@link WebConsoleUtils#userFromSession(org.jgrapes.http.Session)}.
160     *
161     * @param event the event
162     * @param channel the channel
163     */
164    @Handler(priority = 800)
165    @SuppressWarnings({ "PMD.AvoidInstantiatingObjectsInLoops",
166        "PMD.AvoidLiteralsInIfCondition", "PMD.CognitiveComplexity" })
167    public void onConsolePrepared(ConsolePrepared event,
168            ConsoleConnection channel) {
169        var permissions = new HashMap<String, Set<Permission>>();
170        for (var conletType : knownTypes) {
171            var conletPerms = new HashSet<Permission>();
172            for (var role : WebConsoleUtils
173                .rolesFromSession(channel.session())) {
174                conletPerms.addAll(permissionsFromRole(conletType, role));
175            }
176            permissions.put(conletType, conletPerms);
177        }
178
179        // Disable non-addable conlet types in GUI
180        for (var e : permissions.entrySet()) {
181            if (!e.getValue().contains(Permission.ADD)) {
182                channel.respond(new UpdateConletType(e.getKey()));
183            }
184        }
185        channel.setAssociated(this, permissions);
186    }
187
188    /**
189     * Evaluate the permissions contributed by the given role for the
190     * given conlet type.
191     *
192     * @param conletType the conlet type
193     * @param role the role
194     * @return the sets the
195     */
196    @SuppressWarnings("PMD.AvoidBranchingStatementAsLastInLoop")
197    private Set<Permission> permissionsFromRole(String conletType,
198            ConsoleRole role) {
199        // Start with defaults
200        for (var rule : acl.getOrDefault(role.getName(),
201            Collections.emptyList())) {
202            // Extract conlet type
203            int pos = 0;
204            while (rule.charAt(pos) == '!' || rule.charAt(pos) == '-') {
205                pos++;
206            }
207            if (rule.startsWith("*")) {
208                return Set.of(Permission.ADD, Permission.RENDER);
209            }
210            if (!conletType.equals(rule.substring(pos).trim())) {
211                // Rule does not apply to this type
212                continue;
213            }
214            if (rule.startsWith("--")) {
215                return Collections.emptySet();
216            }
217            if (rule.startsWith("!") || rule.startsWith("-")) {
218                return Set.of(Permission.RENDER);
219            }
220            // Rule is type name and thus allows everything
221            return Set.of(Permission.ADD, Permission.RENDER);
222        }
223        // Default permissions
224        return Set.of(Permission.RENDER);
225    }
226
227    /**
228     * If the request originates from a client 
229     * (see {@link AddConletRequest#isFrontendRequest()}, verifies that
230     * the user is allowed to create a conlet of the given type.
231     * 
232     * As the conlets that he user is not allowed to use are disabled,
233     * it should be impossible to create such requests in the first place.
234     * However, the frontend code is open to manipulation and therefore
235     * this additional check is introduced to increase security.  
236     *
237     * @param event the event
238     * @param channel the channel
239     */
240    @Handler(priority = 1000)
241    public void onAddConlet(AddConletRequest event, ConsoleConnection channel) {
242        channel.associated(this, Map.class).ifPresent(aP -> {
243            @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
244            var allPerms = (Map<String, Set<Permission>>) aP;
245            var perms = allPerms.getOrDefault(event.conletType(),
246                Collections.emptySet());
247            if (event.isFrontendRequest() ? !perms.contains(Permission.ADD)
248                : !perms.contains(Permission.RENDER)) {
249                event.cancel(true);
250            }
251        });
252    }
253
254    /**
255     * If a role is withdrawn from a user, there may still be conlets in
256     * his stored layout that he is no longer allowed to use. 
257     *
258     * @param event the event
259     * @param channel the channel
260     */
261    @Handler(priority = 1000)
262    public void onRenderConletRequest(RenderConletRequest event,
263            ConsoleConnection channel) {
264        channel.associated(this, Map.class).ifPresent(aP -> {
265            @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
266            var allPerms = (Map<String, Set<Permission>>) aP;
267            var perms = allPerms.getOrDefault(event.conletType(),
268                Collections.emptySet());
269            if (perms.isEmpty()) {
270                event.cancel(true);
271            }
272        });
273    }
274}
